Structs/RVS_SpinnerDataItem.html#/s:11RV.name: title
Structs/RVS_SpinnerDataItem.html#/s:11RV.abstract: This is the optional title for the data item.

Structs/RVS_SpinnerDataItem.html#/s:11RV.name: icon
Structs/RVS_SpinnerDataItem.html#/s:11RV.abstract: This is the required image to be displayed for the data item. This is what is most prominently displayed.

Structs/RVS_SpinnerDataItem.html#/s:11RV.name: description
Structs/RVS_SpinnerDataItem.html#/s:11RV.abstract: This is an optional description String, which can provide more detailed information about the data item.

Structs/RVS_SpinnerDataItem.html#/s:11RV.name: value
Structs/RVS_SpinnerDataItem.html#/s:11RV.abstract: This is any associated data value. It is an optional “Any,” and needs to be cast.

Structs/RVS_SpinnerDataItem.html#/s:11RV.name: isEnabled
Structs/RVS_SpinnerDataItem.html#/s:11RV.abstract: This is the enabled flag for the item. It is defaulted to true.

Structs/RVS_SpinnerDataItem.html#/s:11RV.name: init(title:icon:description:value:isEnabled:)
Structs/RVS_SpinnerDataItem.html#/s:11RV.abstract: The default initializer. The only required argument is the icon.

Structs/RVS_SpinnerDataItem.html.name: RVS_SpinnerDataItem
Structs/RVS_SpinnerDataItem.html.abstract: This struct is used to represent one value of the spinner.

Protocols/RVS_SpinnerDelegate.html#/s:11.name: spinner(_:singleValueSelected:)
Protocols/RVS_SpinnerDelegate.html#/s:11.abstract: This is called if there was only one value, and the user selected the central button.

Protocols/RVS_SpinnerDelegate.html#/s:11.name: spinner(_:hasSelectedTheValue:)
Protocols/RVS_SpinnerDelegate.html#/s:11.abstract: This is called after the user has used the Spinner to select a value.

Protocols/RVS_SpinnerDelegate.html#/s:11.name: spinner(_:hasOpenedWithTheValue:)
Protocols/RVS_SpinnerDelegate.html#/s:11.abstract: This is called after the user has “opened” the Spinner.

Protocols/RVS_SpinnerDelegate.html#/s:11.name: spinner(_:hasClosedWithTheValue:)
Protocols/RVS_SpinnerDelegate.html#/s:11.abstract: This is called after the user has “closed” the Spinner.

Protocols/RVS_SpinnerDelegate.html#/s:11.name: spinner(_:willCloseWithTheValue:)
Protocols/RVS_SpinnerDelegate.html#/s:11.abstract: This is called before the user closes the spinner. It allows the delegate to interrupt the close process.

Protocols/RVS_SpinnerDelegate.html.name: RVS_SpinnerDelegate
Protocols/RVS_SpinnerDelegate.html.abstract: This is the delegate protocol for the Spinner. It is a Swift class protocol, because it provides the delegate with a Swift object, and is weakly referenced by the Spinner.

Classes/RVS_Spinner/SpinnerMode.html#/s:.name: spinnerOnly
Classes/RVS_Spinner/SpinnerMode.html#/s:.abstract: This means that the radial spinner will be used at all times.

Classes/RVS_Spinner/SpinnerMode.html#/s:.name: both
Classes/RVS_Spinner/SpinnerMode.html#/s:.abstract: This means that the Spinner will choose which to bring up, depending upon the value of the spinnerThreshold property, and the number of values in the Array.

Classes/RVS_Spinner/SpinnerMode.html#/s:.name: pickerOnly
Classes/RVS_Spinner/SpinnerMode.html#/s:.abstract: This means that the picker will be used at all times.

Classes/RVS_Spinner.html#/s:11RVS_Spinne.name: delegate
Classes/RVS_Spinner.html#/s:11RVS_Spinne.abstract: This is an optional delegate object that can be informed of selected values.

Classes/RVS_Spinner.html#/s:11RVS_Spinne.name: displayFont
Classes/RVS_Spinner.html#/s:11RVS_Spinne.abstract: This is the display font that we’ll use in the picker. Default is system bold 20. It can be overridden.

Classes/RVS_Spinner.html#/s:11RVS_Spinne.name: selectedIndex
Classes/RVS_Spinner.html#/s:11RVS_Spinne.abstract: This is the selected index of the value Array. It is 0-based.

Classes/RVS_Spinner.html#/s:11RVS_Spinne.name: values
Classes/RVS_Spinner.html#/s:11RVS_Spinne.abstract: This property represents the values to be selected and displayed by the spinner. Instead of a datasource, we use an instance property. This can be overloaded to make it dynamic.

Classes/RVS_Spinner.html#/s:11RVS_Spinne.name: isOpen
Classes/RVS_Spinner.html#/s:11RVS_Spinne.abstract: If this is true, then the spinner is open. Setting this will open or close the control. Default is false.

Classes/RVS_Spinner.html#/s:11RVS_Spinne.name: isCompensatingForContainerRotation
Classes/RVS_Spinner.html#/s:11RVS_Spinne.abstract: If this is true, then center of the spinner will rotate against any rotation applied to its container, making it “straight up.” Default is true.

Classes/RVS_Spinner.html#/s:11RVS_Spinne.name: value
Classes/RVS_Spinner.html#/s:11RVS_Spinne.abstract: This calculated property will return either the currently selected item, or nil. READ-ONLY

Classes/RVS_Spinner.html#/s:11RVS_Spinne.name: framedIcons
Classes/RVS_Spinner.html#/s:11RVS_Spinne.abstract: If we have either a border color (tint), or a background color, then we display the icons enclosed in a frame.

Classes/RVS_Spinner/SpinnerMode.html.name: SpinnerMode
Classes/RVS_Spinner/SpinnerMode.html.abstract: This is just a convenient way to denote the spinner modes.

Classes/RVS_Spinner.html#/c:@M@RVS_Spinn.name: backgroundColor
Classes/RVS_Spinner.html#/c:@M@RVS_Spinn.abstract: This is the background color associated with the “closed” control. We use the UIView’s backgroundColor as the source.

Classes/RVS_Spinner.html#/c:@M@RVS_Spinn.name: tintColor
Classes/RVS_Spinner.html#/c:@M@RVS_Spinn.abstract: This is the tint color , which governs the display of the border, and of text in the picker.

Classes/RVS_Spinner.html#/c:@M@RVS_Spinn.name: openBackgroundColor
Classes/RVS_Spinner.html#/c:@M@RVS_Spinn.abstract: This is the background color associated with the “open” control “pie-slices.” Default is nil (clear).

Classes/RVS_Spinner.html#/c:@M@RVS_Spinn.name: spinnerMode
Classes/RVS_Spinner.html#/c:@M@RVS_Spinn.abstract: This is the spinner mode. It determines which control is displayed when the spinner is open.

Classes/RVS_Spinner.html#/c:@M@RVS_Spinn.name: spinnerThreshold
Classes/RVS_Spinner.html#/c:@M@RVS_Spinn.abstract: This is the maximum number of elements that can be displayed in a spinner.

Classes/RVS_Spinner.html#/c:@M@RVS_Spinn.name: isSoundOn
Classes/RVS_Spinner.html#/c:@M@RVS_Spinn.abstract: If true, the control will play sounds. Default is true.

Classes/RVS_Spinner.html#/c:@M@RVS_Spinn.name: isHapticsOn
Classes/RVS_Spinner.html#/c:@M@RVS_Spinn.abstract: If true, the control will play haptics (on devices that support haptics). Default is true.

Classes/RVS_Spinner.html#/c:@M@RVS_Spinn.name: centerImage
Classes/RVS_Spinner.html#/c:@M@RVS_Spinn.abstract: This is an alternative fixed center image. If left alone, the selected value image will be used. Default is nil (use selected value image).

Classes/RVS_Spinner.html#/c:@M@RVS_Spinn.name: hudMode
Classes/RVS_Spinner.html#/c:@M@RVS_Spinn.abstract: If true, then the various options will be set to emulate a “HUD” display. Default is false.

Classes/RVS_Spinner.html#/c:@M@RVS_Spinn.name: replaceCenterImage
Classes/RVS_Spinner.html#/c:@M@RVS_Spinn.abstract: If true, and an explicit image has been assigned to the center, when the cotrol is opened, the image will be replaced with the current selection.

Classes/RVS_Spinner.html#/c:@M@RVS_Spinn.name: init(coder:)
Classes/RVS_Spinner.html#/c:@M@RVS_Spinn.abstract: The NSCoder init.

Classes/RVS_Spinner.html#/c:@M@RVS_Spinn.name: draw(_:)
Classes/RVS_Spinner.html#/c:@M@RVS_Spinn.abstract: This is called when the control is about to be drawn.

Classes/RVS_Spinner.html#/c:@M@RVS_Spinn.name: init(frame:)
Classes/RVS_Spinner.html#/c:@M@RVS_Spinn.abstract: This is required for a designable.

Classes/RVS_Spinner.html#/c:@M@RVS_Spinn.name: beginTracking(_:with:)
Classes/RVS_Spinner.html#/c:@M@RVS_Spinn.abstract: This is called when we start tracking a pan.

Classes/RVS_Spinner.html#/c:@M@RVS_Spinn.name: continueTracking(_:with:)
Classes/RVS_Spinner.html#/c:@M@RVS_Spinn.abstract: This is called repeatedly while we are tracking a pan. We just make sure that we keep updating the display.

Classes/RVS_Spinner.html#/c:@M@RVS_Spinn.name: endTracking(_:with:)
Classes/RVS_Spinner.html#/c:@M@RVS_Spinn.abstract: We end the tracking, and make sure that we update the display properly.

Classes/RVS_Spinner.html#/c:@M@RVS_Spinn.name: cancelTracking(with:)
Classes/RVS_Spinner.html#/c:@M@RVS_Spinn.abstract: We cancel the tracking, and make sure that we update the display.

Classes/RVS_Spinner.html#/c:@M@RVS_Spinn.name: layoutSubviews()
Classes/RVS_Spinner.html#/c:@M@RVS_Spinn.abstract: This is called before the subviews (aren’t any) will get laid out.

Classes/RVS_Spinner.html#/s:11RVS_Spinne.name: init(values:selectedIndex:frame:spinnerMode:delegate:)
Classes/RVS_Spinner.html#/s:11RVS_Spinne.abstract: A convenience init with a preset values array and value.

Classes/RVS_Spinner.html#/c:@M@RVS_Spinn.name: init()
Classes/RVS_Spinner.html#/c:@M@RVS_Spinn.abstract: A convenience “quiet” init.

Classes/RVS_Spinner.html#/c:@M@RVS_Spinn.name: numberOfComponents(in:)
Classes/RVS_Spinner.html#/c:@M@RVS_Spinn.abstract: Simple number of components response (always 1)

Classes/RVS_Spinner.html#/c:@M@RVS_Spinn.name: pickerView(_:numberOfRowsInComponent:)
Classes/RVS_Spinner.html#/c:@M@RVS_Spinn.abstract: This returns how many rows will be displayed by the pickerview.

Classes/RVS_Spinner.html#/c:@M@RVS_Spinn.name: pickerView(_:viewForRow:forComponent:reusing:)
Classes/RVS_Spinner.html#/c:@M@RVS_Spinn.abstract: This builds one row view, including the icon and the text.

Classes/RVS_Spinner.html#/c:@M@RVS_Spinn.name: pickerView(_:didSelectRow:inComponent:)
Classes/RVS_Spinner.html#/c:@M@RVS_Spinn.abstract: This is called when a row is selected in the picker.

Classes/RVS_Spinner.html.name: RVS_Spinner
Classes/RVS_Spinner.html.abstract: This is a “spinner” control, which acts a bit like a circular UIPickerView.
